Resources

Useful Links

If you haven’t worked with a family lawyer before, not knowing what to expect can make things feel even harder. We take the time to guide you through the process, so you know what comes next and feel supported every step of the way.

Courts and Laws
  • Federal Circuit and Family Court of Australia
  • Your local Magistrates’ Court
  • Application for family violence intervention order can be made via the Magistrates’ Court of Victoria website if it is safe to do so. Applications can still be made in person at court if that is the safest option.
  • Family Law Act
  • Relationships Act
  • Federal Circuit and Family Court of Australia; legal words used in court
Separation & Divorce
  • How do I apply for a Divorce?
  • Leaving a Relationship
  • What is Family Mediation and Dispute Resolution?
  • Family Dispute Resolution Providers
Children & Child Support
  • Kids Corner - Tailored and age appropriate resources for children provided by the Federal Circuit and Family Court of Australia
  • Child Support Estimator
  • Child Support, Services Australia; basic overview of child support matters
  • Child Support Guide; comprehensive overview of child support matters
  • Child Support (Assessment) Act
  • Raising Children
  • Parenting After Separation
  • What about the Children?
Safety & Family Violence Support
  • What is Family Violence?
  • What is Stalking?
  • The Orange Door: a free service for adults, children and young people who are experiencing or have experienced family violence and families who need extra support with the care of children
  • Safe steps: the state-wide access point for those who need to leave a violent situation and access emergency crisis accommodation. Call safe steps on 1800 015 188 for help 24/7.
  • 1800RESPECT: a national sexual assault, domestic family violence counselling service can be contacted on 1800 737 732 to provide counselling, information and support services.
  • Victoria Police
  • Sexual Assault Crisis Line: 1800 806 292.
  • WIRE: the Women’s Information Referral Service’s telephone support service assists Victorian women, nonbinary and gender-diverse people. WIRE can provide assistance to families in financial hardship and situations of financial abuse and family violence.
  • WIRE: the Men’s Referral Service provides help and support for people at risk of family violence on 1300 766 491.

  • In case of emergency, always call 000.

Money, Property & Government Help
  • Australian Tax Office; general information
  • Australian Tax Office; information regarding CGT
  • Calculating CGT for real estate
  • Centrelink
  • Child Support Agency
  • State Revenue Office Calculators
  • Managing Money
  • Money Smart
  • Money Problems with your Partner
  • REIV – Finding a real estate agent
  • Calculating Stamp Duty payable
  • Family Law Online
  • International Child Abduction; official Australian website
Legal Help & Support Services
  • Victoria Legal Aid
  • Women’s Legal Service Victoria
  • Community Legal Centres
  • Relationships Australia
  • Relationship Matters
  • Drummond Street Services
  • Family Relationships Online; government overview of support services
  • Women and Separation – Managing New Horizons
  • Men and Separation – Navigating the Future
  • Law Institute of Victoria
  • Law Council of Australia – Family Law Section
  • Australian Institute of Family Studies
  • International Academy of Collaborative Professionals
